subject: Re: [junit] (unknown)
msgSnippet: ... No, it does not.  JUnit tests must still be written manually.  Code coverage is a separate issue from unit testing, and would require different tools.
messageBody:
marie sauvaud wrote:
>
> Hello,
>
> Does JUnit generate automated tests, by analyzing the
> source code, to cover the maximum number of code
> lines?

No, it does not. JUnit tests must still be written manually. Code
coverage is a separate issue from unit testing, and would require
different tools.

Moreover, i would personally find it extremely difficult to trust a tool
that was testing for code coverage, rather than states and workflows.
Testing code coverage may make management feel good because it sounds
simple, but it doesn't really detect bugs very well. Until testing
software gets MUCH smarter, manual test writing will be an important
task.
--
